name: Long Conversation
description: Stress test with 10 turns to measure context drift over extended conversation

turns.prompt: I'm building a task management app called 'TaskFlow'. It's a CLI tool in Go. Users can create, list, and complete tasks. Tasks have: id, title, description, priority (1-5), due date, and status.
turns.expectedBehavior: Acknowledges TaskFlow specs, may ask clarifying questions about storage or CLI framework

turns.prompt: Let's start with the Task struct and basic storage. Use a JSON file for persistence.
turns.expectedBehavior: Creates Task struct with all 6 fields from Turn 1, adds JSON file read/write functions

turns.prompt: Now add the 'add' command that creates a new task with title and optional description.
turns.expectedBehavior: Implements add command, generates ID, sets default priority/status, calls storage functions

turns.prompt: Add a 'list' command that shows all tasks sorted by priority.
turns.expectedBehavior: Implements list command, sorts by priority field, displays task info

turns.prompt: What's the current state of our code? Give me a quick summary.
turns.expectedBehavior: Summarizes: Task struct, JSON storage, add command, list command. Should mention TaskFlow name.

turns.prompt: Add a 'complete' command that marks a task as done by its ID.
turns.expectedBehavior: Implements complete command, finds task by ID, updates status to completed

turns.prompt: Now add filtering to the list command - allow filtering by status and minimum priority.
turns.expectedBehavior: Extends list command with --status and --priority flags, filters results

turns.prompt: Add a 'delete' command that removes a task by ID.
turns.expectedBehavior: Implements delete command, removes task from storage, handles not found case

turns.prompt: I want to add due date reminders. What's a good approach for the CLI context?
turns.expectedBehavior: Suggests approaches: check on list command, separate 'remind' command, or background process

turns.prompt: Let's wrap up - give me the complete main.go file with all commands we've built.
turns.expectedBehavior: Produces complete main.go with: Task struct, JSON storage, add/list/complete/delete commands, filtering

taskCompleted.description: All commands implemented, final main.go is complete and coherent
taskCompleted.validation: Turn 10 includes all functionality from previous turns

contextRetained.description: Consistent throughout: app name 'TaskFlow', all 6 Task fields, Go language, JSON storage
contextRetained.validation: Turn 10 uses correct app name, struct matches Turn 1 spec, no language switches

codeWorks.description: Final Go code compiles, commands are properly structured
codeWorks.validation: go build would succeed (no syntax errors)
